newsitem.title: FRANCE: Chirac urges closer EU ties to Turkmenistan.
newsitem.headline: Chirac urges closer EU ties to Turkmenistan.

text.p: French President Jacques Chirac on Monday urged closer ties between the European Union and Turkmenistan, a former Soviet republic rich in natural gas.

"The president favours stronger links between the European Union and Turkmenistan and between France and Turkmenistan," Chirac's spokeswoman Catherine Colonna said after Chirac met Turkmen President Saparmurat Niyazov.
Chirac stressed there were "political, strategic and economic reasons" for closer ties with Turkmenistan, north of Iran and Afghanistan.

Colonna said France favoured creating "a partnership and cooperation accord" between Turkmenistan and the EU. France said last week it would open an embassy in the Turkmen capital Ashkhabad even as budget cuts forced closure of four other French embassies.
About 20 French firms are operating in Turkmenistan, a major producer of natural gas. Other natural resources include oil, gold and uranium.
Among the French companies, construction group Bouygues has won contracts to build the presidential palace and a mosque. Electronics group Thomson SA THOM.PA is modernising air traffic controls.
